intro: Lebeckia brevicarpa, commonly known as the silver leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spherical, silvery-gray foliage and bright yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in garden landscapes. Lebeckia brevicarpa is also noted for its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators.
